edu.biu.protocols.CommitmentWithZkProofOfDifference

Class CmtWithDifferenceReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.CommitmentWithZkProofOfDifference.CmtWithDifferenceReceiver

  • public class CmtWithDifferenceReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
    This protocol is used in the input consistency check.

    It reveals the xor of both committed values without revealing the committed values themselves.

    Meaning, given two commitments: Hcom(s) Hcom(s'), we want to reveal s^s' without revealing s and s'.

    This class represents the receiver of the protocol.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CmtWithDifferenceReceiver

        public CmtWithDifferenceReceiver(CutAndChooseSelection selection,
                                 int numCircuits,
                                 int statisticalParameter,
                                 Channel channel,
                                 java.security.SecureRandom random,
                                 CryptographicHash hash)
        A constructor that sets the given parameters and initialize them.
        Parameters:
        selection - The cut and choose selection.
        numCircuits - Total number of circuits (eval+chacked)
        statisticalParameter - Indicates how much commitments pairs will be.
        channel - Used to communicate between the parties.
        random - Used to initialize the commitment scheme.
        hash - Used in the commitment scheme.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
           throws java.io.IOException
        The setup phase of the protocol.

        Generate CmtCCommitmentMsg from w and k. Generate decommit values for w and k. Send the created CmtCCommitmentMsg to the committer.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receiveCommitment

        public void receiveCommitment(CmtCCommitmentMsg[][] commitments)
        Sets the given commitments.
        Parameters:
        commitments - The commitments to set.

      • revealCutAndChooseSelection

        public void revealCutAndChooseSelection()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the decommitment of the key for the encryption scheme so that the other party can decrypt ccSelection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of a problem during the communication.

      • receiveDecommitment

        public byte[] receiveDecommitment(int k,
                                  int counter,
                                  DecommitmentsPackage pack)
                           throws CheatAttemptException
        Extracts from the given package the committed value, all randoms used to commit and the decommitment objects.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the checked circuit. The decommitments should be verified against the commitments from the k index.
        counter - The index of the checked circuit in the selection.
        pack - THe package received from the committer that contains the committed value, randoms and decommitments.
        Returns:
        the committed value, if the decommitments were all verified.
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - In case there was a decommitment that was not verified.

      • getBundle

        public DifferenceCommitmentReceiverBundle getBundle(int j)
        Returns a DifferenceCommitmentReceiverBundle that contains some data of this protocol.
        Parameters:
        j - The index of the required commitment.

      • verifyDifferencesBetweenMasks

        public byte[][] verifyDifferencesBetweenMasks(java.util.ArrayList<DifferenceCommitmentReceiverBundle> bucket)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              CheatAttemptException
        Verifies the difference by receive the difference of each pair of bundles, send w and than verify the decommitments of the differences.
        Parameters:
        bucket - Contains the DifferenceCommitmentCommitterBundle to verify.
        Returns:
        the committed differences.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of a problem during the communication.
        CheatAttemptException - In case the verification fails.
